quest.name: Food for the Soul
journal: Judging by her sheepish expression, Tataru has a favor to ask.
objectives: Deliver the Archon loaf to the Crystal Exarch in the Ocular.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: You've come a long way, so do take your ease while you can.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Um...Forename? Could you spare a moment? While Krile goes and finds this expert of hers, I mean.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: There's a gift I was hoping to send to our friends in the First, you see...and since we might be waiting a while, I wondered if you wouldn't mind giving me a hand with it.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: My first attempt turned out well, so now I'm going to make it properly.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: I'll be in the kitchen at the House of Splendors. Meet me there!

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Well, I had better be off too. I shall see you soon, either here or at the House, depending on how our patients fare in my absence.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: There you are, Forename! As I'm sure you've guessed, the gift is a bit of home cooking.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Unlike Krile, I can't do much to help our friends directly. But that doesn't mean I've been idle.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: No, I've been doing my best for the order, taking on this job and that to keep our coffers full. I've even helped out with the Ishgardian restoration.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: And in the course of all this, my culinary skills have come on quite a bit. So I thought, why not make something for our friends?

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: It's baking in the oven even as we speak. Shouldn't be long now!

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: There! Baked to perfection, even if I do say so myself!

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: It's...bread.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Smells great!

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Your cake looks like bread.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: But not just any old bread! This here is Old World bread. “Archon loaf,” to be precise. It's what they eat over in Sharlayan!

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Doesn't it just! It's called “Archon loaf,” in case you're wondering, and it's what they eat over in Sharlayan.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: It is bread, silly! And not just any old bread. This here is Old World bread. “Archon loaf,” to be precise. It's what they eat over in Sharlayan!

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Simple fare, I admit, but I thought it would remind our friends of home.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: If nothing else, Krile tells me it's a good source of aether.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: So it should lend them a bit of strength at least.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Mmm-mmmmmm! There truly is nothing like the smell of bread fresh from the oven!

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Krile! And if it isn't Rammbroes too!

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: I trust you require no introductions either, Forename.

dialogue.name: RAMMBROES
dialogue.text: Greetings, my friend. Full glad am I to see you well.

dialogue.name: RAMMBROES
dialogue.text: I confess, I have a malm-long list of questions to ask you, but I will endeavor to contain my curiosity for the present. I understand our mutual friend is struggling with the application of certain Allagan technologies.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: I have been keeping Rammbroes apprised of events in the First. Suffice it to say, he knows about the Exarch.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: If anyone alive can provide insight into this matter, it is him and his fellow Sons.

dialogue.name: RAMMBROES
dialogue.text: Ahem. Loath as I am to disappoint you after so glowing an endorsement...

dialogue.name: RAMMBROES
dialogue.text: Memory transference was the sole province of Allagan royalty, its mechanisms closely guarded secrets. If any record of them remains, we have yet to find it. To wit, I regret that I can offer no solution to your problem.

dialogue.name: RAMMBROES
dialogue.text: ...Which begs the question of why I bothered to come here, empty-handed as I am─the answer being, rather brazenly, to ask a favor. I would have you relay a message to our comrade.

dialogue.name: RAMMBROES
dialogue.text: Tell him... Tell him that we never doubted him.

dialogue.name: RAMMBROES
dialogue.text: Never doubted that he would achieve all that he said he would.

dialogue.name: RAMMBROES
dialogue.text: Those of us who remained behind have yet to play our part.

dialogue.name: RAMMBROES
dialogue.text: But when the time comes, he may rest easy in the knowledge that we will most assuredly do so.

dialogue.name: RAMMBROES
dialogue.text: And then the tower shall shine once more as a beacon of hope, in this world and beyond.

dialogue.name: RAMMBROES
dialogue.text: So tell him that we consider his duty done─and that he should follow his heart now.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Forgive me, but do you say this to discourage him from overexerting himself? Or to encourage him to hold nothing back?

dialogue.name: RAMMBROES
dialogue.text: That is for our friend to decide, but either way, I daresay a certain someone will be unimpressed.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Well, there you have it, Forename. If you would be so good as to see Rammbroes's message and Tataru's bread to their intended recipients─along with my report, of course.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Um, Krile? Before I wrap the bread up, would you mind giving it a try? Just to make sure everything's as it should be?

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: But of course! I'm always happy to lend my taste buds!

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Hmmm... Hmmmmmm...

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Excuse me, Rammbroes. As a fellow Sharlayan, may I trouble you for your opinion?

dialogue.name: RAMMBROES
dialogue.text: Well, I usually have mine with a good dollop of rolanberry jam, but I suppose plain is best for sampling purposes.

dialogue.name: RAMMBROES
dialogue.text: <munch> <munch> I see, I see...

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Oh no... Is it that bad?

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: It is indeed, Tataru. Dense and unpleasant...exactly as it should be!

dialogue.name: RAMMBROES
dialogue.text: Gahaha! Just so! The very taste of home!

dialogue.name: RAMMBROES
dialogue.text: As you might expect, our countrymen have amassed a wealth of culinary wisdom from every corner of the world. But our native cuisine is...shall we say, a little lacking.

dialogue.name: RAMMBROES
dialogue.text: In Sharlayan, the majority regard food as a source of nourishment rather than enjoyment. Save for those few who actually research the culinary arts, we pay little heed to the niceties of taste and texture.

dialogue.name: RAMMBROES
dialogue.text: It was against such a gastronomic landscape that what is now called the “Archon loaf” was born, the creation of an Archon who devoted himself to the study of bodily sustenance.

dialogue.name: RAMMBROES
dialogue.text: In order to maximize its nutritional value, he incorporated copious quantities of pulverized fish and vegetable matter into the dough─all with nary a care for those qualities which make bread enjoyable. The result is a flavor that continues to defy description.

dialogue.name: RAMMBROES
dialogue.text: Yet for its many shortcomings, the loaf's nutritional value cannot be denied. And being a damnably convenient way to cater to one's bodily needs, it quickly found an audience amongst busy scholars. Why, when I was a lad, nigh every meal was a sandwich made with this very bread and whatever ingredients happened to be on hand.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Hm hm! I suspect just about every Archon could say the same.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Having been away from home for so long, I thought I might have forgotten the taste. But no─it is all too familiar. Ahhh, how it takes me back...

dialogue.name: RAMMBROES
dialogue.text: If there is enough, perhaps you can spare some for the Exarch? He is certain to appreciate it.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Oh, there's plenty to go around. I'll be sure to wrap up an extra slice!

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Forename, when you deliver the loaf, please be sure to send everyone my regards.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Tell them we're doing everything we can, and that we'll be praying for their safe return until the moment they get back.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Well...it sounds like it'll do them good, anyway.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: And when everything's back to normal, I'll cook something for you too, Forename. Gods know you deserve a treat!

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: Ah, you are returned! Good, good. There is much to discuss. The others are making their way hither as we speak.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: Welcome back, my friend. How was your journey?

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: By the Twelve... Archon loaf! However did you come by this? I'd swear it had come straight from Sharlayan...

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: Rammbroes said that, did he? <sigh> His words are very nearly as heavy as the bread...but I appreciate the sentiment.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: Should you have the chance, you may tell him that he needn't worry. That which I seek to do, I do of my own volition, and with all my heart.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: In pursuing this path, I fully expect to earn the censure of our friends─and to deserve it─but I shall forge on regardless.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: Forge on as you yourself did when faced with a similar predicament. So I ask that you have faith in me. In what we do.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: ...But we were talking about your journey. Before the others arrive, I would hear how their bodies fare.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: Oh, and the bread I shall save for later. Though it has been many years, I have not forgotten the feats of mastication required to consume it, nor how unconducive they are to conversation.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: As Beq Lugg said, the test will take a while. I ask for your patience in the meantime.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: Off you go and help your friends. Even assuming the test is a success, I doubt they would feel comfortable leaving with business unfinished.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: When our grandfather first decided to journey to Eorzea, Alisaie did not take kindly to my silence on the subject. “Don't pretend to understand things you don't,” she said...or rather shouted.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Having oft been the object of her scorn, I am predisposed to sympathize with the Exarch, but I do understand how she feels─better now than ever I did, certainly.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I'm sorry, I know it was childish to storm off like that. And probably to feel the way I do as well. Agh, pull yourself together, Alisaie!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: I for one support the Exarch's choice. To be alive is to be driven by a purpose, and few are as driven as him.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: It's stupid, but I've never really stopped to think about what would happen once the vessels were complete. And now...

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: No. There's no point. I...I hope the test is a success. Truly.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Hast thou a moment, Forename? I would speak with thee on the matter of the Exarch's mooted return unto the Source.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Thou wilt have observed that our friend spake not in certainties. Yet if Beq Lugg hath the right of it, 'tis possible to predict the outcome of his plan with some confidence.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: And it is their assessment that, given the opportunity, the Exarch's soul should successfully merge with that of his younger self.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Which is not to say the process is without complications. For one, the Exarch hath been subjected to an additional Rejoining, an experience which will have wrought a change in his aetherial composition.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: As thou thyself didst demonstrate in merging with Ardbert, however, there existeth an affinity 'twixt like souls, and this doth give us cause to hope.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: ...Yet there remaineth one immutable condition upon which success doth hinge.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: The Exarch must needs recognize his past self as simply that─himself.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: As our recent travails have demonstrated, memories are essential to the soul. Any discrepancy in the former may feasibly cause the latter to spurn its former flesh.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: 'Tis a seemingly simple yet complex problem. For nigh on a century, our friend hath striven only to deliver this realm, to deliver thee. And to that singular end did he cast aside his very name, that he might assume the mantle of the Crystal Exarch.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Henceforth, none can say what choices our friend will make, but I thought it only right that thou be made aware of these truths.
